comment: Can u show how to use calculus
Can u show me how to use calculas
i wish to know the steps by using calculus.
how do we use calculas in those steps..??

The bit where you were explaining the slope for 0 and 1 order reactions was a bit hard to follow. How can you differentiate between first order and zero order if they both express a negative linear relationship?
How do we use calculus to get tot he next step?? very interested

Integrate. Take the integral of the left side, you get the integral of 1/x dx from initial x to final x, the integral of 1/x is ln(x) so the left integral is ln(x). We are taking a definite integral from the initial concentration to the final concentration of x, so the left side turns out to be ln(xf) - ln(xo). When you take the integral of the right, you get the integral of t from initial t to final t. Since initial t is at time=0, you are just left with t final. So it turns out to be  ln(xf) - ln(xo) = - kt
+John Enciso  YES YES I WOULD LIKE TO KNOW ALSO. =)
y-axis is different. [x] for zero order and ln[x] for first
